content: The Act titled "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" or "Empowering FED Vets Act" establishes veterans employment programs in federal agencies. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" defines a "covered agency" to include various government departments such as State, Treasury, Defense, Justice, Interior, Agriculture, Commerce, Labor, Health and Human Services, Housing and Urban Development, Transportation, Energy, Education, Veterans Affairs, and Homeland Security. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" includes various government departments like State, Treasury, Defense, Justice, Interior, Agriculture, Commerce, Labor, Health and Human Services, Housing and Urban Development, Transportation, Energy, Education, Veterans Affairs, and Homeland Security, along with other Executive agencies designated by the President. The term "transitioning member of the Armed Forces" refers to a member expected to be discharged. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" covers various government departments and Executive agencies designated by the President. It defines a "transitioning member of the Armed Forces" as someone expected to be discharged within 180 days. The Act also outlines the establishment of Veterans Employment Programs within covered agencies to support veterans in finding employment. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" establishes Veterans Employment Programs in covered agencies to enhance job opportunities for veterans. Responsibilities include developing recruitment and training programs, providing counseling, and matching skills to agency needs. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" establishes Veterans Employment Programs in covered agencies to enhance job opportunities for veterans. Agencies must target high-demand Federal occupations, participate in career development programs, and provide training on veterans' employment. The Office of Personnel Management will facilitate coordination among veterans employment officials to match skills and careers. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" establishes a Veterans Program Office to provide leadership in recruiting and employing veterans in the Federal Government. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will convene veterans employment officials for meetings to share best practices and develop training for human resources employees and hiring managers on veterans' employment. The "Empowering Federal Employment for Veterans Act of 2017" establishes a Veterans Program Office to provide leadership in recruiting and employing veterans in the Federal Government. The office aims to develop a skills-based career development program for agencies, promote the government as an employer of choice for veterans, market transitioning military members' talents to agencies, and disseminate federal employment information to veterans and hiring officials. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will submit a report to Congress on progress made towards sharing resources and information among veterans employment officials, developing training programs for human resources employees and hiring managers, career development programs for veterans, and efforts to promote the Federal Government as an employer. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will submit a report to Congress on efforts to promote the Federal Government as an employer of choice to transitioning members of the Armed Forces and veterans. SEC. 3. INTERAGENCY COUNCIL ON VETERANS EMPLOYMENT. Establishment of the Interagency Council on Veterans Employment, consisting of heads of covered agencies and other Executive agencies designated by the President. The Council is co-chaired by the Secretary of Labor and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, with the Director of the Office of Personnel as Vice-chair. The Interagency Council on Veterans Employment, chaired by the Secretary of Labor and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, with the Director of the Office of Personnel Management as Vice Chair, advises the President on increasing veteran employment in the Federal Government. Their duties include enhancing recruitment, training, and job satisfaction for veterans, establishing performance measures, and promoting employment opportunities in the executive branch. The Interagency Council on Veterans Employment, chaired by the Secretary of Labor and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, advises the President on promoting veteran recruitment, retention, training, and job satisfaction in the Federal Government. The Council is required to submit annual reports on the effectiveness of these efforts. The Co-Chairs are responsible for convening meetings, setting the agenda, and directing the Council's work. Additionally, a Steering Committee may be established to provide leadership and strategic direction. The Vice Chair of the Interagency Council on Veterans Employment designates an Executive Director to manage the Council's activities. The Office of Personnel Management provides administrative support within existing appropriations. Expansion of SkillBridge initiative to include participation by federal agencies. The Secretary of Defense will modify the SkillBridge initiative to allow Federal agencies to participate as employers and trainers, providing training to transitioning members of the Armed Forces. The Director will ensure that all Federal agencies participate in the initiative. The term "transitioning member of the Armed Forces" refers to a member expected to be discharged within 180 days after starting training under the SkillBridge initiative.
